answers.answer: Speaking in general terms, an injectable medication requires different chemistry than a pill.  Insulin is a large molecular medication, which cannot be taken orally, and must be delivered subcutaneously or intramuscularly.  Not knowing the structure of HIV meds, it's hard to say.But, if you think about it, might be a bad idea if you have needles and HIV...someone who cleans it up might not be careful and prick themselves.

question: I was wondering if people with HIV can take their medication on their own time by injecting themselves with medicine, much like people with diabetes do.  Does anybody know this?
title: Hiv- injection
